newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: J.Martins seen easing on Vidago bid.
newsitem.headline: J.Martins seen easing on Vidago bid.

text.p: Shares in Portuguese retailer Jeronimo Martins were expected to open lower after it said it would launch a public offer to buy mineral water company Vidago, dealers said.
"We will see tight liquidity at the opening as prices adjust initially to between 13,800 and 13,900 escudos per share," said one dealer.
Another said: "I think Jeronimo Martins will open in illiquid trade and will correct to 13,800 escudos."
Jeronimo Martins closed on Friday at 14,079 escudos.
It said on Saturday it would launch a bid for Vidago at around 4,270 escudos per share. Vidago shares were suspended on the Lisbon bourse on Monday.
